contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = ''Quadrula tuberosa'' | image = |status = GX |status_system = TNC |status_ref = <ref name=natureserve>{{Cite web | publisher =[[NatureServe]] | title = ''Quadrula tuberosa'' | url = http://www.natureserve.org/explorer/servlet/NatureServe?searchName=Quadrula+tuberosa+ | accessdate = 2012-10-06}}</ref> | regnum = [[Animalia]] | phylum = [[Mollusca]] | classis = [[Bivalvia]] | ordo = [[Unionoida]] | familia = [[Unionidae]] | genus = ''[[Quadrula]]'' | species = '''''Q. tuberosa''''' | binomial = ''Quadrula tuberosa'' | binomial_authority = I. Lea, 1840 | synonyms = }} '''''Quadrula tuberosa''''', [[common name]] the '''rough rockshell''', is a [[species]] of [[freshwater mussel]]. It is an [[aquatic animal|aquatic]] [[bivalve]] [[mollusk]] in the family [[Unionidae]], the river mussels. It has sometimes been treated as an [[ecotype]] of [[Quadrula metanevra]]. This species was [[Endemism|endemic]] to the [[Cumberland River]] watershed in the states of [[Kentucky]] and [[Tennessee]]. It is believed to be either extinct or critically endangered due to habitat destruction and pollution. ==See also== *[[List of non-marine molluscs of the United States]] *[[Quadrula]] ==References=== {{Reflist}} ==Source== * Bogan, A.E. 1996. [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/19051/all Quadrula tuberosa]. [http://www.iucnredlist.org 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. ] Downloaded on 7 August 2007. [[Category:Quadrula|tuberosa]] [[Category:Endemic fauna of the United States]] [[Category:Critically endangered fauna of the United States]] [[Category:Fauna of the Southeastern United States]] [[Category:Natural history of Kentucky]] [[Category:Natural history of Tennessee]] {{-}} {{bivalve-stub}}
